questions.question: What is a 'font' in printing and typography?
options: The ink used in printing
A set of characters in a particular size and style of typeface
The paper used for printing
The printing press itself

questions.question: What does 'serif' refer to in typography?
options: The space between lines of text
A small decorative stroke at the end of a letter's main strokes
Bold text formatting
The size of a character

questions.question: What is 'kerning' in typography?
options: The process of inking a printing plate
Adjusting the spacing between individual letter pairs
Cutting paper to the correct size
Aligning text to both margins

questions.question: What does 'CMYK' stand for in printing?
options: Color Mode Yellow Key
Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Key (Black)
Custom Mix Yield Kit
Central Matrix Yield Key

questions.question: What is a 'galley proof' in printing?
options: The final printed version of a book
A preliminary version of printed text for proofreading
The metal tray that holds type
A decorative border around text

questions.question: What does 'leading' (pronounced 'ledding') refer to?
options: The first paragraph of an article
The vertical spacing between lines of type
The use of lead-based ink
The main headline of a page

questions.question: What is a 'colophon' in publishing?
options: The table of contents
A statement at the end of a book giving production details
The book's front cover design
A type of binding technique

questions.question: What is 'movable type'?
options: Text that scrolls across a screen
Individual letter blocks that can be rearranged for printing
A typeface that slants to the right
A rotating printing cylinder

questions.question: What does 'bleed' mean in printing?
options: Ink that smudges on the page
When printed content extends beyond the trim edge of the page
A fault in the printing press
The fading of ink over time

questions.question: What is 'lithography'?
options: Carving letters into stone
A printing process based on the principle that oil and water do not mix
Printing with wooden blocks
Engraving on metal plates

questions.question: What is an 'em dash' in typography?
options: A thin space between words
A long dash the width of the letter M, used for punctuation
A type of bullet point
A footnote marker

questions.question: What does 'typesetting' mean?
options: Designing a new typeface
The process of arranging text for printing
Cleaning the printing press
Binding pages into a book

questions.question: What is a 'gutter' in page layout?
options: The bottom margin of a page
The inner margin between two facing pages
A decorative line at the top of a page
The space reserved for page numbers

questions.question: What is 'embossing' in printing?
options: Printing in multiple colors
Creating a raised design on paper by pressing it from behind
Adding a glossy coating to paper
Printing on both sides of a sheet

questions.question: Who is credited with inventing the movable type printing press in Europe?
options: William Caxton
Johannes Gutenberg
Benjamin Franklin
Aldus Manutius
